background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.

We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与马登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了一个可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了一个新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这些涡旋可以进一步增强纬向风的变化，并进一步影响下游的纬向风，因为涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用。青藏 Plateau（TP）下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋的喷流核心沿线纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北移动。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是，TP上方在200 hPa处存在强烈的负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应与TP上的冷异常相对应，气氛下沉并在上层诱导负位势高度异常。此外，从TP到北太平洋的下游明显显示出波状模式的位势高度差（见图5a）。TP上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧则出现强烈的正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状的位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（见图5b）。此外，冷TP表面的位势高度响应在南半球，特别是在中纬度地区也有所体现（见图5a, b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，能够大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带气候联系（如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系）已被广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，以探索TRC波列的详细特征以及大气环流对青藏高原表面异常的全球响应。众所周知，青藏高原的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球的遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水中的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。新的LS4P第二阶段实验将进一步探讨TRC波列的动力学理解及其向南半球的跨赤道传播。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探讨TP的作用及热带环流波列（TRC波列）在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的具体机制仍需进一步研究。

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常对全球的影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。

findingsCn: LS4P-I结果首次表明，春季的表层温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）从青藏 Plateau 调制，经过东北亚和白令海峡到达北美西部，同时影响春季的西风急流。这种由青藏 Plateau 热异常调制的 TRC 波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的陆面温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节间到季节的变率的主要来源。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏高原（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在生成观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在不同尺度气候系统中的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探讨它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常（如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜）的联系已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内提供有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，尤其是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是研究观察到的2003年5月青藏高原异常低温是否导致了全球热点地区观察到的6月降水异常。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然在科学上具有挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他相关过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（见表ES1）。在第一次实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行第二次实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一次实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏 Plateau（TP）上的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。观察结果和多个地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常对全球的影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。

findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的表层温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球(TRC)波列，从青藏 Plateau 通过东北亚和白令海峡传递到北美西部，并与春季的西风急流相互作用。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的表面温度异常还可以通过产生跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Definition.AnswerEn: LS4P refers to the project 'Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction,' which aims to investigate the impact of springtime land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when using land surface temperature data from the Tibetan Plateau for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction compared to sea surface temperature data for similar predictions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用来自青藏高原的地表温度数据进行亚季节到季节预测时，与使用海表温度数据进行类似预测相比，面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Land surface temperature data face challenges such as preserving memory from initialized anomalies and model biases, whereas sea surface temperature data are limited by the partial explanation of climate predictability and require robust model initialization to overcome prediction challenges.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 陆地表面温度数据面临着保存初始化异常和模型偏差的挑战，而海洋表面温度数据则受到气候可预测性部分解释的限制，并且需要强大的模型初始化来克服预测挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What insights can be drawn about the effectiveness of using initialized land surface temperature and snowpack data in improving subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 关于使用初始化的地表温度和雪盖数据在改善亚季节到季节预测模型中的有效性，可以得出哪些见解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The LS4P project demonstrates that initializing land surface temperature and snowpack data can enhance prediction models by providing a new source of subseasonal-to-seasonal predictability, particularly in high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau. This approach has shown potential in improving the prediction of summer precipitation anomalies in hotspot regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: LS4P项目表明，初始化地表温度和雪盖数据可以通过提供新的亚季节到季节预测能力来增强预测模型，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区。这种方法在改善热点地区夏季降水异常的预测方面显示出潜力。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do inter-model differences impact the interpretation of atmospheric responses to land surface temperature anomalies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同模型之间的差异如何影响对陆地表面温度异常的气候响应的解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Inter-model differences significantly affect the interpretation of atmospheric responses, as seen in the varied propagation pathways and inconsistencies in capturing the TRC wave train. These differences can lead to discrepancies between simulated and observed climate anomalies, highlighting the need for robust model initialization and improved parameterizations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 模型之间的差异显著影响大气响应的解释，正如在传播路径的多样性和捕捉TRC波列的不一致性中所看到的。这些差异可能导致模拟与观测气候异常之间的差异，突显了强有力的模型初始化和改进参数化的必要性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in collecting accurate land surface temperature data over high mountain areas for subseasonal to seasonal prediction models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些因素导致在高山地区收集准确的地表温度数据面临挑战，以用于季节到季节的预测模型？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting accurate land surface temperature data over high mountain areas are attributed to model deficiencies in parameterizations, the lack of balanced initial atmospheric/land conditions in reanalysis data, and significant errors in producing observed surface temperatures in these regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集准确的地表温度数据面临的挑战归因于模型参数化的缺陷、再分析数据中缺乏平衡的初始大气/陆地条件，以及在这些地区产生观测地表温度时存在的显著误差。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to maintain the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in Earth System Models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在地球系统模型中，维护初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆是困难的，原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The difficulty in maintaining the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies lies in the ESMs' inability to preserve these anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions from reanalysis data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维护初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆的困难在于地球系统模型（ESMs）无法保持这些异常，因为模型参数化的缺陷和来自再分析数据的不平衡初始大气/陆地条件。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the biases observed in the ensemble mean of simulated temperature and precipitation differences from models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致模型模拟的温度和降水差异的集合均值观察到偏差的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Biases in the ensemble mean of simulated temperature and precipitation differences are caused by underestimation of temperature effects due to smaller than observed anomalies and potentially due to deficiencies in models' abilities to accurately produce the full temperature anomaly or correct precipitation anomaly.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 模拟温度和降水差异的集合均值中的偏差是由于温度效应的低估，原因是观测到的异常值小于实际值，并且可能是由于模型在准确产生完整的温度异常或修正降水异常方面的缺陷。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using initialized land surface temperature and snowpack data on subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用初始化的地表温度和雪盖数据对亚季节到季节预测准确性的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of initialized land surface temperature and snowpack data has been shown to improve the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions by providing a new source of predictability. It allows models to better simulate the observed anomalies in precipitation, especially in high-mountain regions and global 'hotspot' areas, potentially enhancing prediction skill comparable to the effect of ocean surface temperatures.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用初始化的地表温度和雪盖数据已被证明可以提高亚季节到季节预测的准确性，因为它提供了一种新的可预测性来源。这使得模型能够更好地模拟降水的观测异常，特别是在高山地区和全球“热点”区域，可能增强预测技能，效果可与海洋表面温度的影响相媲美。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the incorporation of springtime land surface/subsurface temperature anomalies influence global atmospheric circulation modeling?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 春季地表/地下温度异常的纳入如何影响全球大气环流模型？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Incorporating springtime land surface/subsurface temperature anomalies into models can significantly affect the global atmospheric circulation by modulating wave trains such as the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train. This can lead to persistent and near-global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, influencing summer temperature and precipitation predictions at the subseasonal-to-seasonal scale.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将春季地表/地下温度异常纳入模型中，可以显著影响全球大气环流，通过调节如青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）波列。这可能导致大气环流的持续和近全球尺度的异常，从而影响亚季节到季节尺度的夏季温度和降水预测。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of utilizing high-resolution grib2 format data for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction experiments derived from land surface temperature anomalies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 利用高分辨率GRIB2格式数据进行基于地表温度异常的亚季节到季节预测实验的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to use high-resolution data to improve the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack in models, which could enhance the predictability of summertime precipitation by understanding and simulating the influence of springtime land surface anomalies over high mountain areas on global atmospheric circulations.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是利用高分辨率数据改善模型中地表温度和雪盖的初始化，这可以通过理解和模拟春季地表异常对高山地区全球大气环流的影响，从而增强夏季降水的可预测性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific procedures are involved in initializing land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions over high mountain areas for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区为亚季节到季节预测模型初始化地表温度和地下温度条件时，涉及哪些具体程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To initialize the land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions over high mountain areas, observed temperature data can be used to adjust the initial conditions in Earth System Models. This involves generating an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the Tibetan Plateau by adjusting initial conditions based on each model’s temperature bias and observed anomalies. The sensitivity runs are then conducted using these new initial conditions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了初始化高山地区的地表温度和地下温度条件，可以使用观测温度数据来调整地球系统模型的初始条件。这涉及到通过根据每个模型的温度偏差和观测异常来调整初始条件，从而生成一种创新的方法来初始化青藏高原的地表温度和地下温度。然后，使用这些新的初始条件进行敏感性试验。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the methodological steps taken to assess the impact of land surface temperature anomalies on global precipitation patterns using Earth System Models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 评估地表温度异常对全球降水模式影响的方法步骤包括使用地球系统模型。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The methodological steps include conducting numerical experiments with Earth System Models to simulate the impact of land surface temperature anomalies. This involves first running control experiments to evaluate model performance and then conducting sensitivity experiments where initial conditions are adjusted to reduce bias. Observed temperature records and global precipitation datasets are used to identify hotspot regions and to validate model predictions against observed climate anomalies.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 方法步骤包括使用地球系统模型进行数值实验，以模拟陆地表面温度异常的影响。这首先涉及运行控制实验以评估模型性能，然后进行灵敏度实验，通过调整初始条件来减少偏差。使用观测温度记录和全球降水数据集来识别热点区域，并将模型预测与观测气候异常进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to ensure accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack in subseasonal-to-seasonal climate models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在亚季节到季节气候模型中，确保地表温度和雪盖准确初始化的方法论有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In the LS4P project, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the Tibetan Plateau T2m and global precipitation. An innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the Tibetan Plateau is introduced by adjusting the initial conditions based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomaly to improve the model's prediction accuracy.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，观察到的T2m记录用于研究青藏高原T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系。通过根据每个模型的T2m偏差和观测异常调整初始条件，提出了一种创新的方法来初始化青藏高原的LST/SUBT，以提高模型的预测准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in collecting and utilizing data from high mountain regions for climate prediction models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集和利用气候预测模型的数据面临哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration are challenging due to a lack of observational data and the inability of current Earth System Models to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies. These challenges are compounded by deficiencies in model parameterizations and in reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置面临挑战，原因在于缺乏观测数据以及当前地球系统模型无法完全保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆。这些挑战因模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的缺陷而加剧。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated challenges in using existing datasets for subseasonal to seasonal prediction of precipitation anomalies, and why might these challenges arise?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用现有数据集进行亚季节到季节的降水异常预测时，预期会面临哪些挑战，以及这些挑战可能出现的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The challenges include inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways and phase differences between simulated and observed wave trains. These challenges arise due to deficiencies in model parameterizations, unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions from reanalysis data, and the inability of models to fully capture the observed temperature anomalies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 这些挑战包括模拟传播路径的模型间差异以及模拟波列与观测波列之间的相位差。这些挑战源于模型参数化的不足、来自再分析数据的不平衡初始大气/陆地条件，以及模型无法完全捕捉到观测温度异常的能力。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What expectations exist for using high-mountain land temperature data in climate models, and what factors might influence the success of these expectations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在气候模型中使用高山土地温度数据的期望是什么，以及哪些因素可能影响这些期望的成功？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The expectation is that high-mountain land temperature data could significantly improve S2S precipitation predictability, potentially as much as ocean surface temperature data. Factors influencing success include the quality of land initialization, model configuration, and the ability to preserve memory from initialized LST anomalies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 预计高山地区的地面温度数据可能会显著提高季节到季节的降水可预测性，潜力可能与海洋表面温度数据相当。影响成功的因素包括地面初始化的质量、模型配置以及保持初始化的地面温度异常记忆的能力。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges do you perceive in the current data collection techniques used for capturing land-atmosphere interaction variables, particularly in high-mountain areas, and how might these be addressed?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为在高山地区用于捕捉陆气相互作用变量的当前数据收集技术中存在哪些挑战，以及这些挑战可能如何得到解决？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current data collection techniques face challenges such as deficiencies in model parameterizations, unbalanced initial conditions in atmospheric/land reanalysis data, and a lack of observational data, particularly in high-mountain regions. Addressing these challenges requires robust land initialization techniques and improved observational coverage to enhance the accuracy and reliability of S2S predictions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集技术面临着诸多挑战，例如模型参数化的不足、大气/陆地再分析数据中的初始条件不平衡，以及缺乏观测数据，特别是在高山地区。解决这些挑战需要强有力的陆地初始化技术和改善观测覆盖，以提高S2S预测的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets from different sources, like NOAA and CRU, are integrated to predict climate anomalies effectively.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解来自不同来源的数据集，如NOAA和CRU，如何有效地整合以预测气候异常。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets from different sources, such as NOAA's CAMS for T2m anomalies and CRU for global precipitation, are used collaboratively to investigate atmospheric circulation and climatology. These datasets are integrated by utilizing observational data and reanalysis models to simulate and analyze patterns like the TRC wave train for S2S prediction.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自不同来源的数据集，如NOAA的CAMS T2m异常和CRU的全球降水，协同用于研究大气环流和气候学。这些数据集通过利用观测数据和再分析模型进行整合，以模拟和分析像S2S预测中的TRC波列模式。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the different data collection methods used to assess the impact of land surface temperature anomalies on subseasonal to seasonal prediction in high mountain areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结用于评估地表温度异常对高山地区亚季节到季节预测影响的不同数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in this field involve using observed temperature data from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS), as well as the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) for atmospheric circulation studies. These methods focus on collecting temperature and precipitation data to explore land-atmosphere interactions and the effects of land surface temperature anomalies on climate prediction.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 该领域的数据收集方法包括使用中国气象局（CMA）和气候异常监测系统（CAMS）观察到的温度数据，以及第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5）用于大气环流研究。这些方法侧重于收集温度和降水数据，以探讨陆地-大气相互作用及陆面温度异常对气候预测的影响。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that could enhance the understanding of land surface temperature effects on global atmospheric circulations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别潜在的数据集，这些数据集可以增强对地表温度对全球大气环流影响的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) data for temperature anomalies, the ERA5 reanalysis data for atmospheric circulation, and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) global precipitation data. These datasets can help in analyzing the global influence of land surface temperature anomalies, particularly in high mountain areas, on atmospheric circulations and precipitation patterns.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS）温度异常数据、ERA5再分析数据（用于大气环流）以及气候研究单位（CRU）全球降水数据。这些数据集可以帮助分析陆地表面温度异常，特别是在高山地区，对大气环流和降水模式的全球影响。
